title.content-text: 3.1.3 - User Applications, Services, and Application Layer Protocols

brief.content-text:
The animation depicts the relationship between applications and services. The O S I model Layer 1 is connected to a switch, which is connected to a router. When the animation starts, application icons and data representations are displayed:
- PDA with a stylus writing text on it: "I'll be home at 5:00".
- PC with text on the screen: "Our company was founded in 2001".
- Phone with an analog signal coming out of it.
- Video camera with a film strip coming from it.

All of these four devices, which are shown as four envelopes, use applications and services at the Application Layer. The four envelopes are then passed down the O S I model layer by layer until they reach a switch and then reach a router. The text at the end of the animation states: "Applications provide the human interface. Services follow protocols to prepare data for the network."
